name: Image control
Encapsulate config
func:
msg.payload = {
	"action": "update_config",
	"config": {
    	"description": {
    		"sample_project": "Project's name",
    		"sample_id": "Sample ID",
    		"sample_uuid": "Sample UUID (Autogenerated)",
    		"sample_ship": "Ship's name",
    		"sample_operator": "Operator's name",
    		"sample_sampling_gear": "Sampling gear used",
    		"sample_concentrated_sample_volume": "Volume of concentrated sample, in mL",
    		"sample_total_volume": "Total volume filtered by the net used, in L",
    		"sample_dilution_factor": "Dilution factor of the sample, 0.5 if diluted by 2, 2 if concentrated by 2",
    		"sample_speed_through_water": "Speed of the boat through water when sampling, in kts",
    		"acq_id": "Acquisition ID",
    		"acq_uuid": "Acquisition UUID (Autogenerated)",
    		"acq_instrument": "Instrument type",
    		"acq_instrument_id": "Instrument ID",
    		"acq_celltype": "Flow cell dimension thickness, in m",
    		"acq_minimum_mesh": "Minimum filtration mesh size, in m",
    		"acq_maximum_mesh": "Maximum filtration mesh size, in m",
    		"acq_min_esd": "",
    		"acq_max_esd": "",
    		"acq_volume": "Pumped volume, in mL",
		    "acq_imaged_volume": "Total imaged volume, in mL",
    		"acq_magnification": "Optical magnification",
    		"acq_fnumber_objective": "Focal length of the objective, in mm",
    		"acq_camera_name": "Name of the camera used",
    		"acq_nb_frame": "Number of picture taken",
            "acq_local_datetime": "Instrument local datetime",
            "acq_camera_resolution": "Resolution of the images",
            "acq_camera_iso": "ISO Number of the images",
            "acq_camera_shutter_speed": "Shutter speed of the images, in s",
            "acq_software": "Software version number",
    		"object_date": "Sample collection date (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_time": "Sample collection time (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_lat": "Sample collection latitude (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_lon": "Sample collection longitude (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_depth_min": "Sample collection minimal depth, in m",
    		"object_depth_max": "Sample collection maximum depth, in m",
    		"process_pixel": "Pixel imaging resolution, in m/pixel",
    		"process_datetime": "Segmentation timestamp",
    		"process_id": "Segmentation ID",
    		"process_uuid": "Segmentation UUID (Autogenerated)",
    		"process_source": "Code source link of the executed code",
    		"process_commit": "Version reference of the executed code",
    		"sample_gear_net_opening": "Sample mouth opening dimension, in mm",
    		"object_date_end": "Sample end collection date when using a net",
    		"object_time_end": "Sample end collection time when using a net",
    		"object_lat_end": "Sample end collection latitude when using a net",
    		"object_lon_end": "Sample end collection longitude when using a net",
    	},
		"sample_project": global.get("sample_project"),
		"sample_id": global.get("sample_project") + "_" + global.get("sample_id"),
		"sample_ship": global.get("sample_ship"),
		"sample_operator": global.get("sample_operator"),
		"sample_sampling_gear": global.get("sample_sampling_gear"),
		"sample_concentrated_sample_volume": global.get("sample_concentrated_sample_volume"),
		"sample_total_volume": global.get("sample_total_volume"),
		"sample_dilution_factor": global.get("sample_dilution_factor"),
		"sample_speed_through_water": global.get("sample_speed_through_water"),

		"acq_id": global.get("sample_project") + "_" + global.get("sample_id")+ "_" + global.get("acq_id"),
		"acq_instrument": global.get("acq_instrument"),
		"acq_instrument_id": global.get("acq_instrument_id"),
		"acq_celltype": global.get("acq_celltype"),
		"acq_minimum_mesh": global.get("acq_minimum_mesh"),
		"acq_maximum_mesh": global.get("acq_maximum_mesh"),
		"acq_min_esd": global.get("acq_min_esd"),
		"acq_max_esd": global.get("acq_max_esd"),
		"acq_volume": global.get("acq_volume"),
		"acq_imaged_volume": global.get("acq_imaged_volume"),
		"acq_magnification": global.get("acq_magnification"),
		"acq_fnumber_objective": global.get("acq_fnumber_objective"),
		"acq_camera": global.get("acq_camera"),
		"acq_nb_frame": global.get("nb_frame"),
		"acq_software": global.get("acq_software"),

		"object_date": global.get("object_date"),
		"object_time": global.get("object_time"),
		"object_lat": global.get("object_lat"),
		"object_lon": global.get("object_lon"),
		"object_depth_min": global.get("object_depth_min"),
		"object_depth_max": global.get("object_depth_max"),

		"process_pixel": global.get("process_pixel"),
		"process_source": global.get("process_source"),
		"process_commit": global.get("process_commit")
	}
};

if (msg.payload.config.sample_sampling_gear.startsWith("net")) {
	msg.payload.config["sample_gear_net_opening"] = global.get("sample_gear_net_opening")
	msg.payload.config["object_date_end"] = global.get("object_date_end")
	msg.payload.config["object_time_end"] = global.get("object_time_end")
	msg.payload.config["object_lat_end"] = global.get("object_lat_end")
	msg.payload.config["object_lon_end"] = global.get("object_lon_end")
}

if ( msg.send == true){
	return [msg, msg]
}
else{
	return [msg, null]
}

name: Logs
format:
The PlanktoScope software application consists of three components: a Node-RED dashboard which provides the user interface you're using; a Hardware Controller which executes commands sent from the Node-RED dashboard for hardware control and image acquisition; and a Segmenter which processes an acquired dataset of images and isolates objects from those images. Each component has its own independent log of messages, managed separately from the logs for the other components.

All three components have live-updating logs which you can monitor. Additionally, the Hardware Controller and the Segmenter also save all of their log messages to files which you can browse and download. Those software components create a new log file each time they start, and the name of the log file includes the time in the PlanktoScope's clock when the software component started. However, if your PlanktoScope's clock is usually wrong, it makes the log files difficult to navigate. This will be fixed in a future version of the software.

If you need to share your logs with other people (e.g. on Slack or GitHub), you should open the "Downloadable Logs" links, and then you can select one file or multiple log files for downloading as a zip archive.

  • Node-RED:
    • Live-updating logs (log in as the "pi" user with the "pi" user's password)
    • Certain errors generated in the dashboard: see the "Dashboard errors" panel on this page.
  • Hardware Controller:
    • Live-updating logs (log in as the "pi" user with the "pi" user's password)
    • Downloadable logs
  • Segmenter:
    • Live-updating logs
    • Downloadable logs
  • Operating System:
    • Live-updating logs (log in as the "pi" user with the "pi" user's password)

name: parse SSID
update contry code
add network
func:
var data = msg.payload

var command = `wpa_passphrase "${data.ssid}" "${data.password}" | sed '/#psk=".*"/d' | sudo tee -a /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf > /dev/null`
 
msg.payload = command

return msg

name: showMessage
func:
msg.payload = "Wifi configuration updated successfully, please connect to the network you just used."
return msg;

name: reset wpa_supplicant.conf
func:
country_code = flow.get("country_code")

var template = `sudo tee /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf <<EOF
ctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant GROUP=netdev
update_config=1
country=${country_code}

EOF`

msg.payload = template
return msg;

          hide-details
          label="Flowrate"
          :thumb-size="20"
        />
      </v-col>

      <v-col cols="12" sm="5">
        <v-text-field
          v-model.number="flowrate"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="ml/min" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          v-model="flowratePreset"
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
          color="primary"
          variant="outlined"
          divided
          shaped
          mandatory
          @update:model-value="onFlowrateToggle"
        >
          <v-btn
            v-for="value in flowratePresets"
            :key="'flowrate-' + value"
            :value="value"
            class="flex-grow-1"
          >
            {{ value }}
          </v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Volume -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="8">
        <v-slider
          v-model.number="volume"
          :min="min"
          :max="max"
          :step="0.2"
          class="align-center"
          hide-details
          label="Volume"
          :thumb-size="20"
        />
      </v-col>

      <v-col cols="12" sm="4">
        <v-text-field
          v-model.number="volume"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="ml" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          v-model="volumePreset"
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
          variant="outlined"
          color="primary"
          divided
          shaped
          mandatory
          @update:model-value="onVolumeToggle"
        >
          <v-btn
            v-for="value in volumePresets"
            :key="'volume-' + value"
            :value="value"
            class="flex-grow-1"
          >
            {{ value }}
          </v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Direction Control -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          variant="outlined"
          v-model="direction"
          color="primary"
          mandatory
          divided
          shaped
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
        >
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'backward'">Backward</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'stop'">Stop</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'forward'">Forward</v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      min: 0.02,
      max: 30,
      flowrate: 10,
      volume: 10,
      flowratePreset: null,
      volumePreset: null,
      flowratePresets: [0.02, 0.2, 2, 20],
      volumePresets: [0.02, 2, 10, 20],
      direction: 'stop',
    };
  },
  watch: {
    flowrate(newVal) {
      this.flowratePreset = this.flowratePresets.find(val => val === newVal) ?? null;
    },
    volume(newVal) {
      this.volumePreset = this.volumePresets.find(val => val === newVal) ?? null;
    },
  },
  methods: {
    onFlowrateToggle(val) {
      if (val != null) {
        this.flowrate = val;
      }
    },
    onVolumeToggle(val) {
      if (val != null) {
        this.volume = val;
      }
    },
  },
};
</script>

<template>

    <v-row>

        <v-slider
          v-model.number="distance"
          :max="max"
          :min="min"
          :step="25"
          class="align-center"
          hide-details
          label="Distance"
          :thumb-size="20"
        />
      </v-col>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="4">
        <v-text-field
          v-model.number="distance"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="m" append-icon="mdi-information"
        />
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Preset Distances -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          variant="outlined"
          v-model="distancePreset"
          divided
          shaped
          color="primary"
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
          mandatory
          @update:model-value="onDistanceToggle"
        >
          <v-btn
            v-for="value in presetDistances"
            :key="'distance-' + value"
            :value="value"
            class="flex-grow-1"
          >
            {{ value }}
          </v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Directional Focus Control -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-btn-toggle
          variant="outlined"
          v-model="focusDirection"
          color="primary"
          mandatory
          divided
          shaped
          class="d-flex justify-space-between"
        >
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'left'">Left</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'stop'">Stop</v-btn>
          <v-btn class="flex-grow-1" :value="'right'">Right</v-btn>
        </v-btn-toggle>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      min: 25,
      max: 5000,
      distance: 25,
      distancePreset: null,
      presetDistances: [25, 150, 500, 5000],
      focusDirection: 'stop',
    };
  },
  watch: {
    distance(newVal) {
      const exactMatch = this.presetDistances.find((val) => val === newVal);
      this.distancePreset = exactMatch ?? null;
    },
  },
  methods: {
    onDistanceToggle(val) {
      if (val != null) {
        this.distance = val;
      }
    },
  },
};
</script>

name: Illustration of the Flow
content:
## Illustration of the Flow

### **1. UI Event**
**Node Name**: `UI Event`  
**Description**: Captures user events from the dashboard (e.g., page navigation).  
**Connected Dashboard**: `My Dashboard`.

```javascript
// Emits messages with the topic and page path when an event occurs.
```

---

### **2. Switch: `$pageview`**
**Node Name**: `msg.topic === "$pageview"`  
**Description**: Filters messages where `msg.topic` equals `$pageview`, ensuring only page navigation events are processed.

**Rule**:
```javascript
msg.topic === "$pageview";
```

---

### **3. Switch: `/load`**
**Node Name**: `msg.payload.page.path === "/load"`  
**Description**: Filters messages to pass only those where the page path matches `/load`.

**Rule**:
```javascript
msg.payload.page.path === "/load";
```

---

### **4. Debug**
**Node Name**: `msg.payload.page.path`  
**Description**: Outputs the value of `msg.payload.page.path` to the debug sidebar in Node-RED for monitoring purposes.

```javascript
// Outputs:
// msg.payload.page.path
```

---

## Supporting Details

- **Dashboard Base**: `My Dashboard`  
  - Accessible at `/dashboard`.  
  - Includes navigation and notification configurations for seamless user interaction.

---

name: get global variable
set global variable
Illustration of the Flow
content:
## Illustration of the Flow

### **1. Get Global Variable**
**Node Name**: `get global variable`  
**Description**: Retrieves a global variable (`variable`) stored in the Node-RED context.

```javascript
// Retrieve the global variable
msg.variable = global.get('variable');

return msg;
```

---

### **2. Template**
**Node Name**: `template`  
**Description**: Displays a Vue.js-based text field in the user interface, allowing the user to view and update the global variable.

```html
<template>
    <v-divider class="my-5"></v-divider>
    <v-text-field
        label="My variable"
        variant="outlined"
        v-model="msg.variable"
        @update:model-value="send({ variable: msg.variable })"
    ></v-text-field>
</template>
```

---

### **3. Set Global Variable**
**Node Name**: `set global variable`  
**Description**: Updates the global variable (`variable`) with the value entered in the UI text field.

```javascript
// Set a value in the global context
global.set('variable', msg.variable);

return msg;
```

---

## Supporting Details

- **UI Group**: `Value and payloads`  
  Groups the widgets under a dashboard section for better organization.

- **UI Page**: `Data in global.json`  
  Displays the group on a dashboard page accessible via the `/data` URL.

- **Theme**: `FairScope Theme`  
  Configures the visual style of the dashboard, using a clean and modern design with primary and background colors.

content:
### Distribution of Object Sizes  
Understanding the size distribution of planktonic objects helps identify dominant size classes and detect anomalies. A skewed distribution might indicate specific biological trends, such as a bloom of a particular species or a technical issue in the acquisition process.  

*In the graph:*  
- A **peak in smaller sizes** suggests dominance of tiny plankton.  
- A **broad distribution** indicates a mix of various size classes.  
- A **skewed or bimodal pattern** may reflect biological or technical factors (e.g., species-specific blooms or imaging biases).

name: elongation vs. area
content:
### Relationship Between Elongation and Object Area  
This scatter plot helps assess whether larger objects tend to be more elongated or compact. Certain plankton species have characteristic shapes, and identifying correlations between elongation and area can aid in distinguishing different taxa or understanding morphological variability.  

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Large and highly elongated objects (e.g., filamentous plankton).  
- **Bottom-right**: Small but highly elongated objects (e.g., thin needle-like forms). 
- **Top-left**: Large but compact objects (e.g., rounded or clustered plankton). 
- **Bottom-left**: Small and compact objects (e.g., spherical or short structures).

name: elongation vs. area
label: elongation vs. area
xAxisLabel: elongation (ratio of major to minor axis)

name: equivalent_diameter vs. MeanValue
content:
### Variation of Mean Brightness with Equivalent Diameter  
This graph explores whether larger objects tend to be brighter or darker. This can reveal differences in pigmentation, transparency, or even imaging inconsistencies.  

*In the graph:*   
- **Top-right**: Large and bright objects.
- **Top-left**: Small and bright objects.
- **Bottom-right**: Large and dark objects.
- **Bottom-left**: Small and dark objects.

name: MeanSaturation vs. MeanValue
content:
### Relationship Between Mean Saturation and Mean Brightness
This visualization helps understand how color properties vary with brightness. Some plankton groups exhibit distinct coloration, and saturation could be a useful feature for classification. A strong trend might suggest systematic differences in pigmentation or optical properties across plankton groups.

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Bright and highly saturated objects (vivid colors).  
- **Top-left**: Bright but low-saturation objects (pale or near-white).  
- **Bottom-right**: Dark but highly saturated objects (deep, rich colors).  
- **Bottom-left**: Dark and low-saturation objects (grayish or faintly colored).

2. Measure the Current Saturation Level

format:
<template>
  <v-card title="3. Observe the current White Balance Settings">
    <v-card-text>
      <canvas id="wbChart"></canvas>
    </v-card-text>
  </v-card>
</template>



<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      chart: null,
    };
  },
  mounted() {
    this.$nextTick(() => {
      this.createChart(); // Initialize the chart after the component is fully mounted
    });
  },
  beforeDestroy() {
    if (this.chart) {
      this.chart.destroy(); // Clean up the chart if the component is destroyed
    }
  },
  methods: {
    createChart(hexColor = '#000000') {
      const canvas = document.getElementById('wbChart');
      if (!canvas) {
        console.error("Canvas element not found.");
        return;
      }

      const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
      if (!ctx) {
        console.error("Unable to get canvas context.");
        return;
      }

      const ratios = this.calculateRatiosFromHex(hexColor);

      if (this.chart) {
        this.chart.destroy(); // Ensure any existing chart is destroyed before creating a new one
      }

      this.chart = new Chart(ctx, {
        type: 'scatter',
        data: {
          datasets: [
            {
              label: 'Current WB',
              data: [{ x: ratios.bgRatio, y: ratios.rgRatio }],
              backgroundColor: 'blue',
              borderColor: 'black',
              borderWidth: 1,
              pointRadius: 10,
              pointHoverRadius: 15,
            },
            {
              label: 'Acceptable WB',
              data: [{ x: 1, y: 1 }],
              backgroundColor: '#5cd65c',
              borderColor: 'black',
              borderWidth: 1,
              pointRadius: 50,
              pointHoverRadius: 55,
              pointStyle: 'circle',
              fill: true,
              showLine: false,
            },
          ],
        },
        options: {
          responsive: true,
          maintainAspectRatio: true,
          scales: {
            x: {
              type: 'linear',
              position: 'bottom',
              title: {
                display: true,
                text: 'B/G Ratio',
              },
              min: 0.8,
              max: 1.2,
            },
            y: {
              type: 'linear',
              title: {
                display: true,
                text: 'R/G Ratio',
              },
              min: 0.8,
              max: 1.2,
            },
          },
          plugins: {
            legend: {
              display: true,
            },
          },
          animation: {
            duration: 0, // Disabling animations might prevent some update issues
          },
        },
      });
    },
    calculateRatiosFromHex(hex) {
      const r = parseInt(hex.slice(1, 3), 16);
      const g = parseInt(hex.slice(3, 5), 16);
      const b = parseInt(hex.slice(5, 7), 16);

      const rgRatio = r / g || 0;
      const bgRatio = b / g || 0;

      return { rgRatio, bgRatio };
    },
  },
  watch: {
    msg(newMsg) {
      if (newMsg && newMsg.acq_wb_hex) {
        this.createChart(newMsg.acq_wb_hex);
      }
    },
  },
};
</script>

<style scoped>
#wbChart {
  width: 100% !important;
  height: 400px !important;
}
</style>

name: 4. Adjust White Balance Settings
format:
<template>
  <v-card title="4. Adjust White Balance Settings">
    <v-card-text>
      Use the suggested values to adjust the white balance based on the color input.
    </v-card-text>
    <v-card-text>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4"></v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">Current</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">Suggested</v-col>
      </v-row>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4">AWRed</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="currentAWRed" disabled variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="suggestedAWRed" variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4">AWBlue</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="currentAWBlue" disabled variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="suggestedAWBlue" variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>
    </v-card-text>
    <v-card-actions>
    <v-card-text>
      We have calculated better values for your AWRed and AWBlue : 
    </v-card-text>
      <v-btn color="primary" @click="sendSettings" variant="outlined">Improve</v-btn>
    </v-card-actions>
  </v-card>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  props: ['id'],
  data() {
    return {
      currentAWRed: '',
      currentAWBlue: '',
      suggestedAWRed: '',
      suggestedAWBlue: '',
    };
  },
  mounted() {
    this.setupSocketListeners();
  },
  methods: {
    setupSocketListeners() {
      if (this.$socket) {
        this.$socket.on('msg-input:' + this.id, (msg) => {
          if (msg.acq_wb_red !== undefined) {
            this.currentAWRed = msg.acq_wb_red;
          }
          if (msg.acq_wb_blue !== undefined) {
            this.currentAWBlue = msg.acq_wb_blue;
          }
          if (msg.acq_wb_hex !== undefined) {
            this.calculateSuggestedAW(msg.acq_wb_hex);
          }
        });
      }
    },
    hexToRgb(hex) {
      hex = hex.replace(/^#/, '');
      let bigint = parseInt(hex, 16);
      let r = (bigint >> 16) & 255;
      let g = (bigint >> 8) & 255;
      let b = bigint & 255;
      return { r, g, b };
    },
    calculateSuggestedAW(hexColor) {
      const { r, g, b } = this.hexToRgb(hexColor);
      let redAdjustment = (g - r) + parseInt(this.currentAWRed, 10);
      let blueAdjustment = (g - b) + parseInt(this.currentAWBlue, 10);
      this.suggestedAWRed = Math.max(0, redAdjustment);
      this.suggestedAWBlue = Math.max(0, blueAdjustment);
    },
    sendSettings() {
      const payload = {
        payload: {
          action: "settings",
          settings: {
            white_balance_gain: {
              blue: this.suggestedAWBlue,
              red: this.suggestedAWRed,
            },
          },
        },
        acq_wb_blue:this.suggestedAWBlue,
        acq_wb_red:this.suggestedAWRed,
        
        topic: "imager/image",
        
      };
      this.send(payload);
    },
  },
};
</script>
